DataElement.preferredName: Prior Infusion Procedure Culture Procedure Bacteria Fungi Infectious Disorder Other Organism Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe other bacterial or fungal organism(s) in a laboratory culture prior to infusion.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Infusion Procedure Culture Procedure Bacteria Fungi Infectious Disorder Other Organism
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion._Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms._Unicellular, prokaryotic organisms that reproduce by cell division and usually have cell walls; can be shaped like spheres, rods or spirals and can be found in virtually any environment._A kingdom of eukaryotic, heterotrophic organisms that live as saprobes or parasites, including mushrooms, yeasts, smuts, molds, etc. They reproduce either sexually or asexually, and have life cycles that range from simple to complex. Filamentous fungi refer to those that grow as multicellular colonies (mushrooms and molds)._A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003_Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Any individual living thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.:Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms.

Concepts.definition: Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms.

Property.preferredDefinition: Unicellular, prokaryotic organisms that reproduce by cell division and usually have cell walls; can be shaped like spheres, rods or spirals and can be found in virtually any enviroment. (BioTech Life Science Dictionary):A kingdom of eukaryotic, heterotrophic organisms that live as saprobes or parasites, including mushrooms, yeasts, smuts, molds, etc. They reproduce either sexually or asexually, and have life cycles that range from simple to complex. Filamentous fungi refer to those that grow as multicellular colonies (mushrooms and molds).:A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003:Not otherwise specified.:A living thing, such as an animal, a plant, a bacterium, or a fungus.

Concepts.definition: Unicellular, prokaryotic organisms that reproduce by cell division and usually have cell walls; can be shaped like spheres, rods or spirals and can be found in virtually any environment.

A kingdom of eukaryotic, heterotrophic organisms that live as saprobes or parasites, including mushrooms, yeasts, smuts, molds, etc. They reproduce either sexually or asexually, and have life cycles that range from simple to complex. Filamentous fungi refer to those that grow as multicellular colonies (mushrooms and molds).
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify a lab value or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: For the bacterial or fungal i
ReferenceDocuments.description: For the bacterial or fungal infection cultures performed prior to infusion, specify other organism:

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2762109
ReferenceDocuments.description: "PerformedObservationResult > PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode WHERE DefinedObservation.nameCode = ""perform culture on <organism name>"" AND PerformedObservation.dateRange IS LESS THAN {infusion date}  {infusion date} is determined by: Subject > PerformedSubstanceAdministration.dateRange WHERE PerformedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Administer Hematopoietic Stem Cell Product{transplantation}"""

DataElement.changeDescription: .1/31/14mn - added alt name for 2006. Added human readable def. System generated def displayed as alt def. No version needed. AK 10/26/14
